  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Fleet Officer",
  "description": "Sunrose Consulting Limited -&nbsp;Our client provides unmatched logistics support in leisure and business to individuals and corporate clients in Vehicle Rental, Fleet Management, Leasing and Manpower Outsourcing. It is designed for the discerning traveler and the optimisation manager. The company has over 25years experience in all round Transportation Management Services.
With branches in Lagos, Kano, Abuja, Calabar, Accra (Ghana), as well as outlets through strategic alliances with hotels, resorts, sports and entertainment venues, the company is positioned to meeting its clients&rsquo; transport logistics needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Fleet Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Fleet Officer plays a vital role in ensuring the smooth operations and maintenance of the fleet of vehicles in the company.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain meticulous records on fleet operations, vehicle maintenance, and fuel consumption.
	Regularly schedule and conduct site visits to clients&#39; and vehicle locations. Review and assess on-site driver and vehicle activities, ensuring compliance and service quality.
	Effectively manage vehicle-related complaints. Receive and document complaints from drivers, and promptly liaise with the maintenance unit to initiate necessary checks and repairs.
	Receive, coordinate, and plan job requests from the Marketing team. Ensure efficient and timely dispatch of resources to meet service requirements.
	Collaborate closely with the Maintenance Team to oversee vehicle repairs. Ensure repairs are executed promptly, resulting in vehicles being rental-ready, and minimising downtime.
	Maintain a fleet of backup vehicles to cover breakdown periods. Upon repair completion and certification, ensure the timely return of standby vehicles.
	Efficiently manage vehicle dispatch and maintain an accurate Daily Dispatch Record.
	Oversee proper fuel management for all vehicles. Reload fuel cards for client vehicles as per approved fuel budgets, ensuring constant fuel availability.
	Daily verification of the fuel portal to confirm fuel purchases as reported by drivers. Vigilantly flag unauthorised fuel card usage and conduct fuel consumption analysis to track purchases and usage.
	Initiate requests for accessories required for fleet vehicles. Follow up with the Admin team to facilitate the timely procurement of requested items.
	Ensure optimal and cost-effective deployment of drivers to suitable locations, meeting the company&#39;s operational goals.
	Promptly report all vehicle incidents and accidents to the relevant team/platform. Facilitate proper documentation and follow-up procedures.
	Actively engage in periodic driver training programs to enhance skills and stay updated on best practices.
	Flexibility to undertake additional assignments delegated by the Head of Department, Supervisor, or the management.
	Demonstrate the ability to perform various duties and responsibilities as directed by the executive management.


Qualifications and Experience&nbsp;


	B.Sc Degree / HND
	2-4 years of relevant experience in Fleet management roles.


Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:


	Must possess a good knowledge and awareness of the industry
	Strong attention to detail
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Good analytical and problem-solving skills
	Good time management and organisational skills
	Ability to analyse data, statistics and translate results into better solutions


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their application letter and CV to:&nbsp;info@sunroseconsulting.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

With the corporate vision of 'building a world-class group of full series of commercial vehicles', the company has accelerated the pace of independent innovation, continuously increased investment in research and development, introduced high-end technical talents, created a working and entrepreneurial ecology, and built high-end national independent brands.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Reporting to the Managing Director, you will set the tone for the entire human resources department.
	You will maintain and enhance the organisation's human resources by planning, implementing, and evaluating employee relations and human resources policies, programs, and practices.
	You will make a significant contribution to the strategic direction and management of the company’s business through advice and implementation of people and culture solutions to ensure effectiveness in attracting, managing, developing, motivating and retaining top quality staff.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Manage the staffing process, including recruiting, interviewing, hiring and onboarding
	Ensure job descriptions are up to date and compliant with all local, state and federal regulations
	Develop training materials and performance management programs to help ensure employees understand their job responsibilities
	Create a compensation strategy for all employees based on market research and pay surveys; keeps the strategy up to date
	Investigate employee issues and conflicts and bring them to resolution
	Ensure the organisation’s compliance with local, state and federal regulations
	Use performance management tools to provide guidance and feedback to team
	Ensure all company HR policies are applied consistently
	Maintain company organisation charts and employee directory
	Partner with management to ensure strategic HR goals are aligned with business initiatives
	Maintain HR systems and processes
	Conduct performance and salary reviews
	Provide support and guidance to HR staff
	Analyse trends in compensation and benefits
	Design and implement employee retention strategies


Requirements


	Degree-qualified, you must have a minimum of 8 years of experience managing human resources in a structured organisation.
	You must have a deep and up-to-date knowledge in HR development and be versatile in the Nigerian Labour law.
	You must have all-round management abilities with strengths in communication, administration and influencing.
